reviews.review_msg: I took introduction to special topics: cybercrime with Barry. He is a great prof and really funny! He let us chose which test format worked for us. The tutorial grade is half participation and half quiz based from the readings. The only thing is he can be kinda quick with the slides - so warm up your typing fingers prior to class. But defs take him

Barry is one of my fav prof in SFU hands down. He's super hilarious!! If you can choose a prof to take, get into his class because u won't regret it! The material in this class is pretty interesting. His tests are also pretty straightforward if you take good notes and put in the time.

Don't bother reading the required articles for the lecture (no textbook required), but read the tutorial articles 'cause you got those iclicker quizzes to do. Note all his iclicker questions. Great prof, funny. No idea why I took this course, too much effort for the credits I received. Make sure to take good lecture notes.

Must attend lectures to earn your 20% tutorial marks. Exams were somewhat difficult, or at least more difficult than most expected. Average was quite low (as well as on the term paper) and he had to scale up. Overall, you'll either find the course very interesting or quite boring. Depends on your interest in cybercrime
